title: Wrong template infer inheritance
body:
**EDIT**: see comment below, this isn't a problem with stubs, I can reproduce it on playground: https://psalm.dev/r/72dd0c2084

I'm creating a plugin with stubs, and I created a [dedicated branch](https://github.com/thomasvargiu/psalm-plugin-fantasy-land/tree/98d0feea3fb02e74b91f5e9692be5535585e7540) for this issue.

The problem is with method [`Identity::map()`](https://github.com/thomasvargiu/psalm-plugin-fantasy-land/blob/98d0feea3fb02e74b91f5e9692be5535585e7540/stubs/Useful/Identity.phpstub#L37-L44).
It's the implementation from the interface [Functor](https://github.com/thomasvargiu/psalm-plugin-fantasy-land/blob/98d0feea3fb02e74b91f5e9692be5535585e7540/stubs/Functor.phpstub), which is another stub with the same signature.

Psalm doesn't recognize the return type as you can see from the CI (https://github.com/thomasvargiu/psalm-plugin-fantasy-land/runs/1376311199?check_suite_focus=true#step:8:50).

So, calling the following method with `fn (T): int` returns a `Functor<empty>` instead a `Functor<int>`.
```php
/**
 * @template T
 */
interface Functor
{
    /**
     * @template F
     * @psalm-param callable(T): F $function
     * @psalm-return Functor<F>
     */
    public function map(callable $function) : Functor;
}
```

The weird thing is that if I remove the docblock from the the [original interface file](https://github.com/functional-php/fantasy-land/blob/1.0.0/src/FantasyLand/Functor.php#L9-L16) it works as expected.
